getSegmentDisplay

public final java.lang.Object getSegmentDisplay(java.lang.String segCode)
Returns the segment value presented on the UI.

Parameters:
segCode - the segment code; null indicating the discriminator segment
Returns:
the value that is presented on the UI. The value presented on the UI can be different from the value saved in the DB when the associated value set is a translated value set or ID-based table-validated value set.

setSegmentAttribute

public final void setSegmentAttribute(java.lang.String segCode,
                                      java.lang.Object value)
Sets the segment attribute with a value. If the segment attribute has a display attribute, the display attribute will be updated as well.

Parameters:
segCode - the segment code
value - the value to be set
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given segment code is null, or no attribute is found for the given segment code.

the flexfield entity on which this row is based
Throws:
FlexfieldJboException - if the flexfield entity cannot be found

segmentOldValueToString

public static java.lang.String segmentOldValueToString(java.lang.Object viewRow,
                                                       java.lang.String segCode)
Gets the string representation of the last committed value of a segment.

Parameters:
viewRow - the flexfield view row
segCode - the segment code. null indicates the discriminator segment.
Returns:
the string representation of the last committed value of the segment; null if the given view row is not a flexfield view row or maintaining/retrieving old values is not supported
